alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:20AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A low pressure system sitting just off the coastline is bringing strong southerly winds and moderate rainfall to the Bay Shoreline. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Mateo and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 915 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Berkeley, Richmond, Daly City, San Mateo, San Leandro, Redwood City, Mountain View, Alameda, Union City, Milpitas, Palo Alto, South San Francisco and Cupertino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
